metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the end function is properly supported
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evaluate to true if the interpreter properly supports the end function.

criterion.comment: Test that the end function is supported with a character value for the character attribute and a single string component that does not end with the character value specified in the character attribute.
Test that the end function is supported with a character value for the character attribute and a single string component that ends with the character value specified in the character attribute.
Test that the end function is supported with a string value for the character attribute and a single string component that does not end with the string value specified in the character attribute.
Test that the end function is supported with a string value for the character attribute and a single string component that ends with the string value specified in the character attribute.

variable_test.comment: Test that the end function is supported with a character value for the character attribute and a single string component that does not end with the character value specified in the character attribute.
Test that the end function is supported with a character value for the character attribute and a single string component that ends with the character value specified in the character attribute.
Test that the end function is supported with a string value for the character attribute and a single string component that does not end with the string value specified in the character attribute.
Test that the end function is supported with a string value for the character attribute and a single string component that ends with the string value specified in the character attribute.

local_variable.comment: Applying the end function with a character argument 'e' to the string 'appl'.
Applying the end function with a character argument 'e' to the string 'apple'.
Applying the end function with a string argument 'pple' to the string 'a'.
Applying the end function with a string argument 'pple' to the string 'apple'.
